item.title: Accept That it’s Your Fault
item.description: Accept That it’s Your Fault Accept that it’s your fault. You are accountable for everything. Mistakes aren’t “the team’s” fault. They are your (the leader’s) fault.

item.title: Share in the Credit
item.description: Share in the Credit Share in the credit Most say “take blame, pass credit.” But I say take blame, share in the credit.

item.title: [[2022-06-16]] Amazing Call with Matt From YEA
item.description: 2022-06-16 Amazing Call with Matt From YEA • [[Make Projects “Their Baby”]] [[Centralize Information, Decentralize Leadership]] • Setting time aside for people to brainstorm tasks for their projects, then have them switch off with each other • [[You need structure to build structure]] • I need to brush up my Effective Altruism Skills

item.title: Normalize Following Up and Checking In On Slackers
item.description: Normalize Following Up and Checking In On Slackers Recall the times in which you’ve been reached out by someone, or sent a text to a friend.

item.title: [[Brainstorming]] and Why it Doesn't Work When Done Together
item.description: [[Brainstorming]] and Why it Doesn’t Work When Done Together Worrying about negative judgement of others Working less when others share responsibility ([[Diffusion of Responsibility]]) Limitations of attention/working memory while others in the group are stating their ideas 1 2 3 title: The Fix Split up and generate ideas alone
